page.title: 02FARMING IN KIRKSTEAD AREA
page.content: {FARMING IN KIRKSTEAD AREA.} Farming in the area is mainly arable on fertile fen land,consisting of heavy clay,light loam,silt and black commons land.Artificial fertiliser and chemical sprays are widely used to give improved yields.Crops grown are wheat,barley,oats(cereals)potatoes and sugarbeet(root crops).Farmers have recently started growing oil seed rape which is proving successful.Some may grow seeds or hay to feed their stock, a few rear and fatten calves.There is a very famous herd of Lincoln Red Cattle which produces prizewinning show beasts.Many of these calves and bulls are exported to many countries. Size of farms varies enormously; several are rented by farmers from Lincolnshire County Council;these smallholdings are about 75 acres,size of the land varies with owners.
